issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

resolution.description: Signifies completion of tasks, info requests, etc.
resolution.name: Completed

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.
status.name: Resolved

fields.description: When an ELB is bound to an AutoScaling group, the ASG's instances are automatically registered with the ELB, so we shouldn't display that ASG's instances as selectable on the ELB Instances page
fields.summary: ELB Instances page shouldn't allow ASG instance deselection if the ELB is registered for the AutoScaling group

comments.body:
It seems like funny things happen if I do add another instance to an ELB that's already set up w/ an autoscaling group.
The scaling group instance no longer appears "in-service" and when I try removing my instance from the ELB, even though the elb is still registered w/ the scaling group, the group instance doesn't appear in the ELB.
I'm suspicious that something isn't right on the back end. I'll test w/ AWS.
[~dkavanagh]: [~spark] can probably comment more here, but I suspect registering instances that aren't in the scaling group with the ELB is no bueno.

I tried same experiment on AWS. Same results. Then, I added instance in scaling group into elb, and terminated it. New instance automatically added to elb this time, so it resumed using the ASG. Will test same on Euca. (and Euca does the same thing.. consistency good)
If instances are in a scaling group fronted by the ELB, we should just gray them out in the selection table so they aren't actionable, but the user can still see them.

Instance selection appears to be working again (after fixing GUI-2564), so this ticket should gray out the ASG instances automatically registered in the ELB to prevent instance de-selection (per Jenny's comment above).  Updated ticket title to clarify what's needed here.

Hi [~kgill], Things seem to be working OK on the LB detail pages, but when I tried to create an ELB in your branch it wouldn't let me select any instances at all. None of the checkboxes would check. 

Chrome, OSX. Verified this works on Master.
Also, the tag editor on create ELB doesn't have the correct styling when disabled. It is correct on instance detail page as an example. Ca you fix that here please? Screenshot attached.

[~jloza]: Fixed issue with instance selection in ELB wizard.  The tag editor issue isn't related to this ticket and, as it is used in a bunch of other places, we should open a separate ticket for that.

hi [~kgill], I opened another ticket for the tag editor issue, it's only messed up on ELBs and ASGs. 

I can check instances now when I create an ELB, but I am able to check the one that is part of the ASG that is fronted by the other ELB. Should that one be available to an additional ELB?
[~jloza]: Yes, I asked Sang-min a similar question and his response indicates there's nothing wrong with selecting that instance.

Confirmed instances in autoscaling group are selected and greyed out.
tested on FF (OS X) and IE11 (Win8.1)

Name        : eucaconsole
Version     : 4.2.2
Release     : 0.9467.194.git37532df.el7
Architecture: noarch
Install Date: Tue 21 Jun 2016 12:00:09 AM PDT
